body:
Seems to crash for every? (tried Ice Woods and Keep of the Grass 2) RA map:

```
Exception of type `System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException`: The given key was not present in the dictionary.
  at System.ThrowHelper.ThrowKeyNotFoundException () [0x00000] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-4.0.4/external/referencesource/mscorlib/system/throwhelper.cs:70 
  at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[OpenRA.Player,OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.FrozenUnderFog+FrozenState].get_Item (OpenRA.Player key) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.FrozenUnderFog.IsVisibleInner (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Player byPlayer) [0x00051] in OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Modifiers/FrozenUnderFog.cs:76 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.FrozenUnderFog.IsVisible (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Player byPlayer) [0x00039] in OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Modifiers/FrozenUnderFog.cs:85 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.FrozenUnderFog.ModifyRender (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer wr, IEnumerable`1 r) [0x0000e] in OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Modifiers/FrozenUnderFog.cs:139 
  at OpenRA.Actor.Render (OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer wr) [0x00020] in OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Actor.cs:149 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.<GenerateRenderables>m__0 (OpenRA.Actor a) [0x00002] in OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Graphics/WorldRenderer.cs:106 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable+<CreateSelectManyIterator>c__Iterator12`2[OpenRA.Actor,OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable].MoveNext () [0x00059] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-4.0.4/mcs/class/System.Core/System.Linq/Enumerable.cs:2299 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable+<CreateConcatIterator>c__Iterator1`1[OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable].MoveNext () [0x0005d] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-4.0.4/mcs/class/System.Core/System.Linq/Enumerable.cs:596 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToArray[IRenderable] (IEnumerable`1 source) [0x0007c] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-4.0.4/mcs/class/System.Core/System.Linq/Enumerable.cs:2896 
  at System.Linq.QuickSort`1[OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable]..ctor (IEnumerable`1 source, System.Linq.SortContext`1 context) [0x00006] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-4.0.4/mcs/class/System.Core/System.Linq/QuickSort.cs:44 
  at System.Linq.QuickSort`1+<Sort>c__Iterator0[OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable].MoveNext () [0x00021] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-4.0.4/mcs/class/System.Core/System.Linq/QuickSort.cs:73 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable+<CreateConcatIterator>c__Iterator1`1[OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable].MoveNext () [0x0005d] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-4.0.4/mcs/class/System.Core/System.Linq/Enumerable.cs:596 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable+<CreateSelectIterator>c__Iterator10`2[OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable,OpenRA.Graphics.IFinalizedRenderable].MoveNext () [0x00059] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-4.0.4/mcs/class/System.Core/System.Linq/Enumerable.cs:2266 
  at System.Collections.Generic.List`1[OpenRA.Graphics.IFinalizedRenderable]..ctor (IEnumerable`1 collection) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToList[IFinalizedRenderable] (IEnumerable`1 source) [0x00006] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-4.0.4/mcs/class/System.Core/System.Linq/Enumerable.cs:2948 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.GenerateRenderables () [0x0011a] in OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Graphics/WorldRenderer.cs:121 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.Draw () [0x0004c] in OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Graphics/WorldRenderer.cs:138 
  at OpenRA.Game.RenderTick () [0x00066] in OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs:513 
  at OpenRA.Game.Loop () [0x0013e] in OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs:641 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00042] in OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs:659 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00011] in OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Support/Program.cs:117 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00050] in OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Support/Program.cs:39
```

There seems to be a behavior change between bleed and this that doesn't look intentional:

If I launch a map on bleed with fog enabled but map explored from lobby settings, actors with `FrozenUnderFog` will not be shown (unless they have been discovered once or `StartsRevealed` is set to `true`, of course), which is basically the expected behavior.

On this branch however, the same actors in the same test case without any changes are visible under fog when the map is set to Explored in the lobby.

So it seems that `StartsRevealed` or some isVisible check isn't considered/modified properly.
@reaperrr: I cannot recreate the issue you describe. Am I missing something?

I suspect I messed up during my original testing. Retested and it works as it should.
:+0.5: for in-game.
Would be nice if someone else could give the code a look-over though, I wouldn't spot any issues other than typos...

Code looks good and works as expected. :+1: 

I'll wait with merging to give Rooster time to decide whether to cache those trait lookups or not.
